description: Decimal expansion of sine of 10 degrees.
comments: Also the imaginary part of i^(1/9). _Stanislav Sykora_, Apr 25 2012
links: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: Equals cos(4*Pi/9) = 2F1(7/6,-1/6;1/2;3/4) / 2 = - 2F1(4/3,-1/3;1/2;3/4) / 2. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 27 2008From _Artur Jasinski_, Oct 28 2008: (Start)Decimal expansion of root of cubic polynomial 1 - 6x + 8x^3.Decimal expansion of casus irreducibilis:1/2 ((-i sqrt(3) - 1)/2)^(2/3) + ((i sqrt(3) - 1)/2)^(2/3)). (End)
